thread.title: Crocker takes Frisco League softball title
thread.title_full: Crocker takes Frisco League softball title

author: Staff reports
title: Crocker takes Frisco League softball title
text: Crocker takes Frisco League softball title The Lady Lions defeated Dixon 5-1 on Tuesday to take the Frisco League title Comment   Staff reports Posted Sep. 30, 2015 at 1:36 PM By Staff reports Posted Sep. 30, 2015 at 1:36 PM The Crocker Lady Lions defeated the Dixon Lady Bulldogs 5-1 on Tuesday to win the Frisco League Conference championship on Tuesday at home. Crocker fell behind 1-0 in the first on a two-out single by Ariel prater that plated Macy Marshall who led off the game with a triple, but it was all Lady Lions the rest of the way in front of their home crowd. Kyla Connell led off the second with a single and scored on a RBI double by Maggie Fancher to tie the game up for Crocker. Two more Lady Lions scored in the fourth, one on a single by Connell (followed by an error by the shortstop) and the second on a bunt single by Tatianna Brumnels. Another pair of runs scored in the sixth on a throwing error by the Dixon catcher. Meanwhile, Delayne Patton was sending Bulldogs back to the bench. She finished with one earned run on two hits and three walks while striking out 10 en route to her 13th win. Patton finishes with a 5-0 record in the Frisco League with an ERA of 0.26. Dixon's run on Tuesday was the only one she has given up to a conference opponent. Tressa Hughes took the loss for Dixon, allowing five runs on nine hits while striking out three in six innings. By Staff reports   Staff reports
